comments:
I20070911-0833.

Got the NPE below.

Test Case:
1. open History view (linking enabled)
2. open context menu while it is empty (still loading)
   ==> wrong:several items enabled, e.g. 'Open' and 'Compare'
3. select 'Compare' or 'Open' both cause an NPE.
==> NPE (see below)

The menu items should be disabled and the actions protected against NPE.

Created an attachment (id=78766)
Patch fixes this problem
Tomasz, can you please review that patch?

Created an attachment (id=79492)
Patch #2

I would rather set the enablement of both actions in CVSHistoryPage#contributeActions method than disabling an action in it's constructor. I know that this is a hypothetical situation, but let assume that someone is creating one of the actions outside the History Page. He or she can be surprised seeing the action disabled by default. 

Moreover, we could probably get away with using compareAction.setEnabled(false) in the contributeActions method instead of compareAction.setEnabled(!treeViewer.getSelection().isEmpty()), but the later looks safer to me.

Also, I corrected indentation in the OpenRevisionAction as I thought it could be a good chance to do it now.

Created an attachment (id=79547)
Patch 003

I agree with Tomek's suggestions. Moreover I removed setPage method and I move initialization of HistoryPage to constructor.
